paper_metadata.title: Effects of PSNP and SPIR Programs in Ethiopia

program_information.program_name: Productive Safety Net Program (PSNP) and SPIR
program_information.target_population: Poor households, including those with elderly or disabled primary income earners
program_information.program_name_citation: The PSNP was launched in 2005 and is one of the largest social protection programs in sub-Saharan Africa. â€¢ This trial was conducted in the context of PSNP 4 (2016 -2021).
program_information.country_citation: The PSNP was launched in 2005 and is one of the largest social protection programs in sub-Saharan Africa.
program_information.target_population_citation: The PSNP provides food or cash transfers (around PPP $277) to poor households in the form of payments for seasonal labor on public works, or as direct support to households whose primary income earners are elderly or disabled.

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The PSNP provides food or cash transfers (around PPP $277) to poor households in the form of payments for seasonal labor on public works

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: SPIR had some positive effects on asset stocks and (particularly) financial inclusion, but did not lead to substantial effects on consumption and income.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This trial was conducted in the context of PSNP 4 (2016 -2021)
